newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends softer on reduced fund inflows.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends softer on reduced fund inflows.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar reversed early gains to close slightly lower against its U.S. counterpart on Wednesday amid reduced foreign fund inflows following the stock market's correction, dealers said.
The local unit ended at T$27.527, off an intra-day high of T$27.513, against Tuesday's T$27.522 close.
Turnover through dealers was a slow US$125 million.
"Expected foreign fund inflows entered only a bit, probably because the stock market encountered its biggest downward correction in recent sessions," said one dealer.
Following seven straight days of rises, the stock index on Wednesday closed down 84.68 points or 0.99 percent at 8,441.52.
Another factor for U.S. dollar demand slightly outstripping supply was the loosening of liquidity in the domestic money market, the dealer said.
Previously, tight liquidity had triggered U.S. dollar selling in exchange for Taiwan dollar cash, dealers said.
"But overall today's trade was thin, and that's probably because investors all went to the stock market," one dealer joked.
For Thursday, a T$27.51-27.54 range was seen.
